Detailed Description

Common 3d object.

This 3d object has one VertexBuffer object and list of child (Basic3D) objects.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Create list of all nodes in hierarchy of this object.

ObjRef<Basic3D> FindChild (  const Char *  name_  ) 
 

Finds child node by name.

All child nodes in all child levels applies for searching.

Parameters:
name_ - searching node name.
Returns:
Returns pointer to the first child with given name, else NULL value (if not found).

void FindChildren (  const Char *  name_,
vector< ObjRef< Basic3D > > &  children_list_
) 
 

Finds child nodes by name and add their into the list.

All child nodes in all child levels applies for searching.

Parameters:
name_ - searching node name.
children_list_ - list to save founding nodes.

ObjRef<Basic3D> FindNearChild (  const Char *  name_  ) 
 

Finds child node by name.

Child nodes in first (nearest) child level applies for searching.

Parameters:
name_ - searching node name.
Returns:
Returns pointer to the first found child node with given name, else NULL value (if not found).

void SetResultTransform (  const Matrix4fx &  rm  )  [virtual]
 

Sets object's result transform matrix.

rm - new object's result transform matrix.

Reimplemented from Basic3D.

Reimplemented in Robot3D.

void TransformToWorld (   ) 
 

Transforms object VertexBuffer to the world coordinates using result transform matrix.

It does the same with all children objects that have class id of Object3D. Set relative and result transform matrix to identity matrix.

void UpdateTransform (   )  [virtual]
 

Updates result transform matrices of objects and all its children.

Need to call after object matrix transform update.

Reimplemented from Basic3D.

Reimplemented in Robot3D.
